git and svn are revision tools. ie. they are responsible for managing files and changes, typically in a directory containing source code
So you use these tools to gain access to a revision of a source repo, then build it with whatever configuration and build tools it requires

Ah, in that case yes. Use the revision tool to download the source, then configure it and compile/install

Well that's how it works. You use revision tools to get the source (git, svn, bzr, hg etc.) then build the source and from that, you can optionally create a distro package
